revised_title: Exploring the Structure and Function of cAMP-Dependent Protein Kinase
tldr: The article discusses the structure and function of cAMP-dependent protein kinase, a critical enzyme in controlling cell growth. The crystal structure of a ternary complex containing MgATP and a 20-residue inhibitor peptide reveals the role of conserved residues at the active site. The enzyme is regulated through covalent modifications and high-affinity binding of protein inhibitors. Understanding the structure and function of this enzyme is essential for studying cellular signaling and growth control.
